products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-account-infra-base
products.label: Account Infrastructure Base
products.short_description: Creates and configures the base layer components of an IBM Cloud account
products.long_description: This architecture supports creating and configuring the foundational components of an IBM Cloud account. This includes IAM account settings, Activity Tracker routing, Cloud Objects Storage, a trusted profile and associated access groups, and the resource group in which all resources are provisioned.

features.title: Configures IAM account settings
features.description: Configures IAM account settings to meet compliance requirements fof the IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services.

features.title: Creates Activity Tracker route and target
features.description: Creates Activity Tracker route and target, sending logs to a Cloud Object Storage bucket.

features.title: Creates access controls
features.description: Creates a trusted profile and associated access group to give Projects access to securely deploy solutions in this account.

features.title: Creates a resource group
features.description: Creates resource group where all resources created by this solution are provisioned.

profiles.profile_name: IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services

architecture.descriptions: The Account Infrastructure Base architecture provides a standardized approach to setting up cloud account settings and related audit logging controls as outlined in the IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services. The architecture includes configurations for IAM settings and access controls that enforce security best practices. Storing Activity Tracker logs in a Cloud Object Storage bucket ensures that the log data is securely retained and easily accessible for analysis, auditing, and compliance purposes. You can use this architecture as a base for deploying additional services and resources in multiple types of accounts, such as administrative or workload accounts.
